titleStmt.title: The triumph of the church over her plotting implacable enemies: being the substance of a moral discourse, delivered on the fifth of November, by that reverend divine, N.V. First, shewing the black barbarity of the Powder-Plot. Secondly, the infinite mercy and goodness of God in preserving these three kingdoms when they were threatned with utter destruction. Thirdly, an exhortation to a holy life, as a suitable return of those favours received.
titleStmt.author: N. V.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Pye-Corner, and J. Deacon at the Angel in Gilt-spur-street, and J. Blare at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge, near the church, and J. Back at the Black-Boy on London-Bridge,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..

place.placeName: the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge, near the church
